00002 using System.Collections.Generic;
00003 using System.Linq;
00004 using Microsoft.Xna.Framework;

00011 using Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Net;
00012 using BulletHell.System;
00013 using BulletHell.Game;
00014 using BulletHell.Game.Object;
00015 using BulletHell.Game.Interface;
00016 using System.Diagnostics;
00017 
00018 namespace BulletHell.System
00019 {
00020     /* An Abstraction layer can be extracted to be used for future menus; reusability. 
00021      * This menu class is super hard to maintain & debug because of the use of classical state transitioning.
00022      * It has to be redesigned to use object oriented hierarchical state transitioning if reusability is concerned. */
00023 
00024     public class Menu : GameState
00025     {
00026         #region Fields
00027         private MenuNode[] menuNodes;
00028         private string[] titles;
00029         private bool[] actives;
00030         private Texture2D arrowTexture;
00031         private Obj arrow;
00032         private Vector2 titlePos;
00033         private Color activeTitleColor, inactiveTitleColor;
00034         private int mouseOverIndex;
00035 
00036         #endregion
00037 
00038         #region Initialization
00039         public Menu()
00040         {
00041             mouseOverIndex = 0; // decides which option has the current focus
00042             titles = new string[] { "Start Game", "Continue", "Credits", "Options", "Exit" }; // Options
00043             actives = new bool[] { true, false, true, true, true }; 
00044 
00045             Debug.Assert(titles.Length == actives.Length);
00046 
00047             menuNodes = new MenuNode[titles.Length];
00048             for (int i = 0; i < menuNodes.Length; ++i)
00049                 menuNodes[i] = new MenuNode(titles[i], actives[i]);
00050         }
00051 
00052         protected override void Initialize()
00053         {
00054             titlePos = new Vector2(_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width - 180, 100);
00055             activeTitleColor = new Color(0, 0, 0, 200);
00056             inactiveTitleColor = new Color(0, 0, 0, 100);
00057 
00058             LoadContent();
00059             arrow = new Obj(arrowTexture, titlePos.X - 70, 100);
00060         }
00061         #endregion
00062 
00063         #region Contents
00064         internal override void LoadContent()
00065         {
00066             arrowTexture = _GLOBAL.ContentManager.Load<Texture2D>(@"sprites\arrow");
00067         }
00068 
00069         protected override void UnloadContent() { }
00070         #endregion
00071 
00072         #region Update and Draw
00073         internal override void Update(GameTime gameTime)
00074         {
00075             _GLOBAL.InputHandler.keyboardState = Keyboard.GetState();
00076             NeedUpdate = true;
00077 
00078             if (_GLOBAL.inGameState)
00079                 return;
00080             
00081             NeedDraw = true;
00082 
00083             /* Keyboard Events, needs to do events with listeners, but I haven't study them. */
00084             if (_GLOBAL.InputHandler.isKeyUp())
00085             {
00086                 /* If the option is inactive, jumps to the next options
00087                  * // This will introduce infinite loops if all options are inactive; 
00088                  * However, all options being inactive is not possible as there will be no option to pick.*/
00089                 while (true) 
00090                 {
00091                     mouseOverIndex = (mouseOverIndex - 1) % menuNodes.Length;
00092 
00093                     /* Note: C# Mod, -1 % N = -1, it will not wrap around! */
00094                     if (mouseOverIndex == -1) mouseOverIndex = menuNodes.Length - 1;
00095                     if (menuNodes[mouseOverIndex].Active) break; // skips inactive options
00096                 }
00097                 _GLOBAL.SoundBank.PlayCue(_GLOBAL.onSelectOption);
00098             }
00099             
00100             if (_GLOBAL.InputHandler.isKeyDown())
00101             {
00102                 while (true) // Reference to the comment on isKeyUp() above
00103                 {
00104                     mouseOverIndex = (mouseOverIndex + 1) % menuNodes.Length;
00105                     if (menuNodes[mouseOverIndex].Active) break;
00106                 }
00107 
00108                 _GLOBAL.SoundBank.PlayCue(_GLOBAL.onSelectOption);
00109             }
00110             
00111             if (_GLOBAL.InputHandler.isKeyEnter())
00112                 selectOption(mouseOverIndex);
00113             
00114             if (_GLOBAL.InputHandler.isKeyEscape())
00115                 selectOption(4); // Selects exit
00116 
00117             _GLOBAL.InputHandler.previousKeyboardState = _GLOBAL.InputHandler.keyboardState;
00118         }
00119 
00120         internal override void Draw(GameTime gameTime)
00121         {
00122             _GLOBAL.SpriteBatch.Begin(SpriteBlendMode.AlphaBlend);
00123             for (int i = 0; i < menuNodes.Length; ++i)
00124             {
00125                 titlePos.Y = i * 30 + 100;
00126 
00127                 if (menuNodes[i].Active)
00128                 {
00129                     _GLOBAL.SpriteBatch.DrawString(_GLOBAL.HuakanFont,
00130                         menuNodes[i].Title, titlePos,
00131                         activeTitleColor, 0.0f, Vector2.Zero,
00132                         (mouseOverIndex == i) ? 1.0f + (float)Math.Cos(gameTime.TotalGameTime.TotalSeconds * 3) / 10 : 1.0f, /* Growing and shringing effect as time goes */
00133                         SpriteEffects.None, 0.0f);
00134                 }
00135                 else
00136                     _GLOBAL.SpriteBatch.DrawString(_GLOBAL.HuakanFont, menuNodes[i].Title, titlePos, inactiveTitleColor);
00137 
00138                 if (mouseOverIndex == i)
00139                 {
00140                     arrow.position.Y = i * 30 + 100;
00141                     _GLOBAL.SpriteBatch.Draw(arrow.sprite, arrow.position, Color.White);
00142                 }
00143             }
00144             _GLOBAL.SpriteBatch.End();
00145         }
00146         #endregion
00147 
00148         #region Methods
00149 
00150         private void selectOption(int index)
00151         {
00152             Debug.Assert(index >= 0 && index <= menuNodes.Length);
00153 
00154             switch (index)
00155             {
00156                 case 0: // Start Game
00157                     menuNodes[index].GameState = new StartGame();
00158                     select(index);
00159                     NeedDraw = false;
00160                     break;
00161                 case 1:
00162                     // Continue;
00163                     NeedDraw = true;
00164                     break;
00165                 case 2: // Credits
00166                     menuNodes[index].GameState = new Credits();
00167                     select(index);
00168                     NeedDraw = false;
00169                     break;
00170                 case 3: // Settings
00171                     NeedDraw = true;
00172                     break;
00173                 case 4: // Exit
00174                     menuNodes[index].GameState = new Dialog("Exit", "Are you sure you want to quit?",
00175                                         new Vector2(_GLOBAL.Viewport.Width/2, _GLOBAL.Viewport.Height/2));
00176                     select(index);
00177                     NeedDraw = true;
00178                     break;
00179             }
00180         }
00181 
00182         private void select(int index)
00183         {
00184             _GLOBAL.GameStateManager.activate(menuNodes[index].GameState);
00185             _GLOBAL.inGameState = true;
00186             if (!_GLOBAL.BGM.IsDisposed)
00187             {
00188                 _GLOBAL.BGM.Stop(AudioStopOptions.Immediate);
00189                 _GLOBAL.BGM.Dispose();
00190             }
00191             _GLOBAL.SoundBank.PlayCue(_GLOBAL.onConfirm);
00192         }
00193         #endregion
00194     }
00195 }
